TECHNICAL_SECTION.FORM_LG_LIST: DA DE EN ES FI FR EL IT NL PT SV CS ET HU LT LV MT PL SK SL GA BG RO HR

CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Investment Bank, European Investment Fund, European Bank for Reconstruction and Development
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: BR604

ML_TI_DOC.TI_TEXT: BERD - Avis général de passation des marchés
BERS - Avviso generale di gara relativo a un appalto
EBWO - Algemene aankondiging van een opdracht
EBOR - Oznámení o obecné veřejné zakázce
EBOR - Oznámenie o vyhlásení všeobecného verejného obstarávania
ЕБВР - Общо обявление за обществена поръчка
BERD - Anunț privind un contract general de achiziții
EBRD - Opća obavijest o javnoj nabavi

CONTENTS.P: Project name: Bohunice International Decommissioning Support Fund – Jadrová a vyraďovacia spoločnosť, a.s.
Country: Slovak Republic
Business sector: Nuclear Safety
Project ID: 8927-GPN-9639
Funding source: BIDSF
Type of contract: Goods, works, supply and installation, consultancy services
Type of notice: General procurement notice
Issue date: 12.1.2018
Closing date: 31.12.2018 at 23:59, Bratislava local time
This notice updates the general procurement notice for this project published on the EBRD’s and JAVYS’s web site and in the Slovak Trade Gazette on 19.1.2017.

The Bohunice International Decommissioning Support Fund (BIDSF), administered by the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development, was established in November 2001 to finance and /or co-finance selected projects over a period of approximately 20 years amounting to approximately 681 000 000 EUR. Jadrová a vyraďovacia spoločnosť, a.s. (JAVYS) is undertaking a programme of pre-decommissioning and decommissioning projects which are consequential to the decision taken by the Slovak Republic to final shutdown Bohunice Nuclear Power Plant, Units 1 and 2 (Bohunice V1 NPP) to be financed and /or co-financed with the resources of the fund. Approval of the project financing is subject to the decision of the Assembly of Contributors of the BIDSF. The assembly may modify the contents of the projects.

The proposed decommissioning support projects would require the procurement of the following goods, works, supply and installation and services contracts in the following areas and/or projects over the next twelve months:
— consultancy services of the PMU consultant,
— correction of the JAVYS power supply system,
— interim storage for special radioactive waste,
— purchase of laboratory equipment for decommissioning process,
— purchase of IT equipment and documentation management system.
Tendering for the above contracts is expected to begin in 2018.
The PMU, which ensures that the decommissioning support projects are completed on time, with a budget within limit and within defined quality standards, will conduct the tendering process.

The procurement of contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a BIDSF grant, administered by EBRD, will be subject to the EBRD procurement policies and rules, available in http://www.ebrd.com/news/publications/policies/procurement-policies-andrules.html All tenders will be open to firms from any country.

The proceeds of the BIDSF grants will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, or for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations or under a law of official regulation of the Purchaser's country.
Interested suppliers, contractors and consultants should contact:

ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.ATTENTION: Mr. Ladislav Marton, Head of Procurement and BIDSF Projects Contract

CONTENTS.P: The following notice refers to goods, works, supply and installation and services to be procured through tendering for a projects financed by the Bohunice International Decommissioning Support Fund (BIDSF) which is administered by the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD). Potential tenderers desiring additional information on the procurement in question or the projects in general should contact the Project Management Unit (PMU) and not the EBRD.

Approval of the project financing is subject to the decision of the Assembly of Contributors of the BIDSF. The assembly may modify the contents of the projects.

The proposed decommissioning support projects would require the procurement of the following goods, works, supply and installation and services contracts in the following areas and/or projects over the next twelve months:
— consultancy services of the PMU consultant,
— correction of the JAVYS power supply system,
— interim storage for special radioactive waste,
— purchase of laboratory equipment for decommissioning process,
— purchase of IT equipment and documentation management system.
Tendering for the above contracts is expected to begin in 2018.
The PMU, which ensures that the decommissioning support projects are completed on time, with a budget within limit and within defined quality standards, will conduct the tendering process.

The procurement of contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a BIDSF grant, administered by EBRD, will be subject to the EBRD procurement policies and rules, available in http://www.ebrd.com/news/publications/policies/procurement-policies-andrules.html All tenders will be open to firms from any country.

The proceeds of the BIDSF grants will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, or for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations or under a law of official regulation of the Purchaser's country.
Interested suppliers, contractors and consultants should contact:

ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.ATTENTION: Mr. Ladislav Marton, Head of Procurement and BIDSF Projects Contract

— consultancy services of the PMU consultant,
— correction of the JAVYS power supply system,
— interim storage for special radioactive waste,
— purchase of laboratory equipment for decommissioning process,
— purchase of IT equipment and documentation management system.
Tendering for the above contracts is expected to begin in 2018.
The PMU, which ensures that the decommissioning support projects are completed on time, with a budget within limit and within defined quality standards, will conduct the tendering process.

The procurement of contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a BIDSF grant, administered by EBRD, will be subject to the EBRD procurement policies and rules, available in http://www.ebrd.com/news/publications/policies/procurement-policies-andrules.html All tenders will be open to firms from any country.

Project name: Bohunice International Decommissioning Support Fund – Jadrová a vyraďovacia spoločnosť, a.s.
Country: Slovak Republic
Business sector: Nuclear Safety
Project ID: 8927-GPN-9639
Funding source: BIDSF
Type of contract: Goods, works, supply and installation, consultancy services
Type of notice: General procurement notice
Issue date: 12.1.2018
Closing date: 31.12.2018 at 23:59, Bratislava local time
This notice updates the general procurement notice for this project published on the EBRD’s and JAVYS’s web site and in the Slovak Trade Gazette on 19.1.2017.

The Bohunice International Decommissioning Support Fund (BIDSF), administered by the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development, was established in November 2001 to finance and /or co-finance selected projects over a period of approximately 20 years amounting to approximately 681 000 000 EUR. Jadrová a vyraďovacia spoločnosť, a.s. (JAVYS) is undertaking a programme of pre-decommissioning and decommissioning projects which are consequential to the decision taken by the Slovak Republic to final shutdown Bohunice Nuclear Power Plant, Units 1 and 2 (Bohunice V1 NPP) to be financed and /or co-financed with the resources of the fund. Approval of the project financing is subject to the decision of the Assembly of Contributors of the BIDSF. The assembly may modify the contents of the projects.

The proposed decommissioning support projects would require the procurement of the following goods, works, supply and installation and services contracts in the following areas and/or projects over the next twelve months:
— consultancy services of the PMU consultant,
— correction of the JAVYS power supply system,
— interim storage for special radioactive waste,
— purchase of laboratory equipment for decommissioning process,
— purchase of IT equipment and documentation management system.
Tendering for the above contracts is expected to begin in 2018.
The PMU, which ensures that the decommissioning support projects are completed on time, with a budget within limit and within defined quality standards, will conduct the tendering process.

The procurement of contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a BIDSF grant, administered by EBRD, will be subject to the EBRD procurement policies and rules, available in http://www.ebrd.com/news/publications/policies/procurement-policies-andrules.html All tenders will be open to firms from any country.

The proceeds of the BIDSF grants will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, or for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations or under a law of official regulation of the Purchaser's country.
Interested suppliers, contractors and consultants should contact:

ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.ATTENTION: Mr. Ladislav Marton, Head of Procurement and BIDSF Projects Contract

CONTENTS.P: The following notice refers to goods, works, supply and installation and services to be procured through tendering for a projects financed by the Bohunice International Decommissioning Support Fund (BIDSF) which is administered by the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD). Potential tenderers desiring additional information on the procurement in question or the projects in general should contact the Project Management Unit (PMU) and not the EBRD.
